arm_group.description: administration of Acetazolamide for 10 days following the surgery
Positioning the patient following surgery for 10 days
applying both Acetazolamide and prone positioning

brief_summary.textblock:
-  Purpose of study : to determine the preventive effect of acetazolamide administration,
           prone positioning, and the combination of both following the neurosurgical
           interventions in lumbosacral region for CSF leak, CSF collection and wound dehiscence.

        -  Sample size: 144

        -  intervention groups:

             -  Group A: Acetazolamide administration for 10 days

             -  Group B: prone positioning for 10 days

             -  Group C: Acetazolamide administration+ prone positioning for 10 days

             -  Group D: no intervention

        -  Period of study: Autumn 2012 to the end of winter of 2014

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Acetazolamide & Position in CSF Leakage and Collection and Wound Dehiscence

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of Acetazolamide adminestration and
      prone positioning following lumbosacral spinal surgery in preventing cerebro spinal fluid
      leakage and collection and wound dehissence in children admited to Children Medical Center
      of Tehran since Autumn 2012 to the end of winter of 2014.The study is run under 4 categories
      of intervention:

        -  Group A: Acetazolamide administration for 10 days

        -  Group B: prone positioning for 10 days

        -  Group C: Acetazolamide administration+ prone positioning for 10 days

        -  Group D: no intervention All patients are randomly assigned to these groups and when
           the patients faced with any of these complications, the protocol changes to
           Acetazolamide administration+ prone positioning and the patient is considered as the
           failure of the protocol.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  dethetering surgery

          -  resection of lipoma

          -  split cord malformation management

          -  having any other disease with similar management technique

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  myelomeningocele

          -  lipomyelomeningocele

          -  meningocele

          -  occupying masses in  spine such as

               -  dermoid cysts

               -  norenteric cysts

          -  those who underwern reoperation

intervention.description: Acetazolamide administration for 10 days adjust dosage with weight of the patient
prone positioning the patient for 10 days following the surgery
administration of acetazolamide and position the patient for 10 days following the surgery

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Effect of Acetazolamide Administration and Prone Positioning Following Lumbosacral Spinal Surgery in Preventing Cerebro Spinal Fluid Leakage and Collection and Wound Dehiscence in Children.

primary_outcome.description: leakage of CSF during 1 months following surgery
collection of the CSF beneath the skin during 1 month following the surgery
dehiscence of the surgical wound during the first month following surgery

reference.citation: Chern JJ, Tubbs RS, Patel AJ, Gordon AS, Bandt SK, Smyth MD, Jea A, Oakes WJ. Preventing cerebrospinal fluid leak following transection of a tight filum terminale. J Neurosurg Pediatr. 2011 Jul;8(1):35-8. doi: 10.3171/2011.4.PEDS10502.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Factorial Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
